poem:
### Numbers Game

In ink and paper, mistakes dance,  
like constellations misaligned,  
a thousand to two hundred,  
officers fade like morning breath.  

Corrections printed, truth rescaled,  
heavy hands lift lighter burdens,  
breeches of dreams stitched anew,  
alternative histories untold.  

In this ledger of letters, we find  
what remains, now balanced,  
on the teetering edge of newsprint.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Corrections and clarifications • An article (Minister accepts England and Wales police face staff cuts, 1 February, p8) said that options being explored by Lincolnshire police included “reducing the number of officers by up to 1,000 by 2029”. In fact, the potential cut is of 200 officers, from 1,200 to 1,000. • Other recently amended articles include: Pressure grows on Met over ‘heavy-handed’ policing of pro-Gaza protest Once more unto the breeches: the 20 best". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Corrections and clarifications • An article (Minister accepts England and Wales police face staff cuts, 1 February, p8) said that options being explored by Lincolnshire police included “reducing the number of officers by up to 1,000 by 2029”. In fact, the potential cut is of 200 officers, from 1,200 to 1,000. • Other recently amended articles include: Pressure grows on Met over ‘heavy-handed’ policing of pro-Gaza protest Once more unto the breeches: the 20 best
